author: Jacky Wong
title: Tencent, and the Tech Sector, Get a Shock From South Africa
text:
When it rains, it pours. Naspers’ purchase of a stake in Chinese tech giant Tencent back in 2001 has bloomed into one of the great investments of the century. Now the South African media and internet company has started selling down its holding, a day after Tencent reported disappointing 2017 results. Investors will surely take this as an evil omen, just when the tech sector doesn’t need more bad news.
The sale of 2% of Tencent, reducing its holding to 31%, will earn Naspers around $10 billion. None too shabby when you consider... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
